---
title: 'Built-in Helpers'
description: 'List of built-in helpers available in the template.'
---

There are many helper functions available for the scaffdog template engine.

## Helpers

### `camel`

Conversion to a camel case.

**Signature:**

```clike
camel(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | camel }}
--> fooBar
```

</Example>

### `snake`

Conversion to a snake case.

**Signature:**

```clike
snake(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | snake }}
--> foo_bar
```

</Example>

### `pascal`

Conversion to a pascal case.

**Signature:**

```clike
pascal(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | pascal }}
--> FooBar
```

</Example>

### `kebab`

Conversion to a kebab case.

**Signature:**

```clike
kebab(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | kebab }}
--> foo-bar
```

</Example>

### `constant`

Conversion to a constant case.

**Signature:**

```clike
constant(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | constant }}
--> FOO_BAR
```

</Example>

### `upper`

Conversion to a upper case.

**Signature:**

```clike
upper(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | upper }}
--> FOO-BAR
```

</Example>

### `lower`

Conversion to a lower case.

**Signature:**

```clike
lower(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "FOO-BAR" | lower }}
--> foo-bar
```

</Example>

### `plur`

Pluralize a word. See the [plur](https://github.com/sindresorhus/plur) documentation for details.

**Signature:**

```clike
plur(value, count?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description                                                                               |
| :-------- | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value.                                                                              |
| `count`   | `number` | The count to determine whether to use singular or plural. If omitted, defaults to plural. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "dog" | plur }}
--> dogs

{{ "dog" | plur 1 }}
--> dog

{{ "dog" | plur 2 }}
--> dogs
```

</Example>

### `replace`

Replace `pattern` with `replacement`. `pattern` is specified as a string, but it is treated as a regular expression.

**Signature:**

```clike
replace(value, pattern, replacement)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter     | Type     | Description                      |
| :------------ | :------- | :------------------------------- |
| `value`       | `string` | Input value.                     |
| `pattern`     | `string` | Pattern string to search.        |
| `replacement` | `string` | String to overwrite found string |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo-bar" | replace "-" "/" }}
--> foo/bar
```

</Example>

### `trim`

Alias for `String.prototype.trim`.

**Signature:**

```clike
trim(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ " foo " | trim }}
--> "foo"
```

</Example>

### `ltrim`

Alias for `String.prototype.trimStart`.

**Signature:**

```clike
ltrim(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ " foo " | ltrim }}
--> "foo "
```

</Example>

### `rtrim`

Alias for `String.prototype.trimEnd`.

**Signature:**

```clike
rtrim(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ " foo " | rtrim }}
--> " foo"
```

</Example>

### `seq`

Generates a numeric array for the specified range. Similar signature to the `seq` command.

**Signature:**

```clike
seq(first, increment?, last?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter   | Type     | Description                           |
| :---------- | :------- | :------------------------------------ |
| `first`     | `number` | Start numeric value.                  |
| `increment` | `number` | Numeric value to be added repeatedly. |
| `last`      | `number` | Last numeric value.                   |

<Example>

```clike
{{ seq 5 }}
--> 1,2,3,4,5

{{ seq 0 5 }}
--> 0,1,2,3,4,5

{{ seq 1 2 10 }}
--> 1,3,5,7,9
```

</Example>

### `append`

Appends elements to an array and returns the resulting array. The array received as an argument is not modified, and immutable operations are performed.

**Signature:**

```clike
append(value, ...args)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type    | Description                        |
| :-------- | :------ | :--------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `any[]` | Input value.                       |
| `args`    | `any[]` | Elements to be added to the array. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ seq 3 | append 10 }}
--> 1,2,3,10

{{ seq 3 | append 4 | append 5 }}
--> 1,2,3,4,5
```

</Example>

### `uniq`

Takes duplicates from array elements and returns the resulting array. The array received as an argument is not modified, and immutable operations are performed.

**Signature:**

```clike
uniq(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type    | Description  |
| :-------- | :------ | :----------- |
| `value`   | `any[]` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ arr := seq 2 | append 1 | append 2 | append 3 }}
{{ arr }}
--> 1,2,1,2,3

{{ arr | uniq }}
--> 1,2,3
```

</Example>

### `split`

Alias for `String.prototype.split`.

**Signature:**

```clike
split(value, sep)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description                      |
| :-------- | :------- | :------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value.                     |
| `sep`     | `string` | Delimiter string value to split. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "1/2/3" | split "/" }}
--> 1,2,3
```

</Example>

### `join`

Alias for `Array.prototype.join`.

**Signature:**

```clike
join(value, sep)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description                     |
| :-------- | :------- | :------------------------------ |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value.                    |
| `sep`     | `string` | Delimiter string value to join. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "1/2/3" | split "/" | join "_" }}
--> 1_2_3
```

</Example>

### `len`

Returns the length of the value. If the length cannot be determined, returns 0.

**Signature:**

```clike
len(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type  | Description  |
| :-------- | :---- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `any` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "123" | len }}
--> 3
```

</Example>

### `slice`

Returns portion of an array. Similar signature to `String.prototype.slice`.

**Signature:**

```clike
slice(value, start, end?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type              | Description                                          |
| :-------- | :---------------- | :--------------------------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `string \| any[]` | Input value.                                         |
| `start`   | `number`          | The first index to include in the return value.      |
| `end`     | `number`          | The index to include at the end of the return value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "12345" | slice 2 }}
--> 345

{{ "12345" | slice 1 3 }}
--> 23
```

</Example>

### `contains`

Searches for an item in a string or array and returns a boolean value.

**Signature:**

```clike
contains(search, item)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type              | Description                      |
| :-------- | :---------------- | :------------------------------- |
| `search`  | `string \| any[]` | A string or array to search for. |
| `item`    | `any`             | Item to search for.              |

<Example>

```clike
{{ contains("foo", "o") ? "true" : "false" }}
--> true

{{ contains("foo", "b") ? "true" : "false" }}
--> false

{{ contains(seq(3), 2) ? "true" : "false" }}
--> true

{{ contains(seq(3), 4) ? "true" : "false" }}
--> false
```

</Example>

### `s2n`

Converts a string to a number.

**Signature:**

```clike
s2n(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "123" | s2n }}
--> 123
```

</Example>

### `n2s`

Converts a number to a string.

**Signature:**

```clike
n2s(value)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `value`   | `number` | Input value. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ 123 | n2s }}
--> "123"
```

</Example>

### `before`

Returns string before the position by `n`. If `n` is a number, it is the specified line; if it is a string, it is the first matched line.

See the [Injection](/docs/templates/injection) section for more information on how to make use of it.

**Signature:**

```clike
before(value, n, offset?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type               | Description                                   |
| :-------- | :----------------- | :-------------------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `string`           | Input value.                                  |
| `n`       | `string \| number` | Pattern string to search. or number of lines. |
| `offset`  | `number`           | Offset from search result position.           |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "line1
line2
line3" | before "line2" }}
--> line1
```

</Example>

### `after`

Returns string after the position by `n`. If `n` is a number, it is the specified line; if it is a string, it is the first matched line.

See the [Injection](/docs/templates/injection) section for more information on how to make use of it.

**Signature:**

```clike
after(value, n, offset?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type               | Description                                   |
| :-------- | :----------------- | :-------------------------------------------- |
| `value`   | `string`           | Input value.                                  |
| `n`       | `string \| number` | Pattern string to search. or number of lines. |
| `offset`  | `number`           | Offset from search result position.           |

<Example>

```clike
{{ "line1
line2
line3" | after "line2" }}
--> line3
```

</Example>

### `eval`

Executes the specified code as JavaScript and returns the result.

**Signature:**

```clike
eval(code)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `code`    | `string` | Source code. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ eval "1 + 2" }}
--> 3
```

</Example>

### `date`

See the [dayjs](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format) documentation for format details.

**Signature:**

```clike
date(format?)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description  |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------- |
| `format`  | `string` | Date format. |

<Example>

```clike
{{ date "YYYY/MM/DD" }}
--> 2019/01/06
```

</Example>

### `noop`

Returns an empty string.

**Signature:**

```clike
noop()
```

<Example>

```clike
{{ "foo" | upper | noop }}
-->
```

</Example>

### `define`

Defines a local variable in the template scope.

**Signature:**

```clike
define(value, key)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description        |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------------- |
| `value`   | `string` | Input value.       |
| `key`     | `string` | Variable key name. |

<Example>

```clike
{{- "foo-bar" | camel | define "name" -}}
{{ name }}
--> fooBar
```

</Example>

### `relative`

Convert the path from the template file to the path from the destination file.

**Signature:**

```clike
relative(path)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description              |
| :-------- | :------- | :----------------------- |
| `path`    | `string` | The file path to search. |

**Example:**

```clike
{{ relative "../src/utils" }}
```

### `resolve`

Resolves a sequence of paths or path segments into an absolute path.

**Signature:**

```clike
resolve(...paths)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type       | Description         |
| :-------- | :--------- | :------------------ |
| `paths`   | `string[]` | File path segments. |

**Example:**

```clike
{{ resolve "../src" "common" }}
```

### `read`

Read the specified file. The contents of the loaded file are also expanded as a template.

**Signature:**

```clike
read(path)
```

**Paramters:**

| Parameter | Type     | Description                           |
| :-------- | :------- | :------------------------------------ |
| `path`    | `string` | Relative path to the file to be read. |

**Example:**

```clike
{{ resolve "../src" "common" }}
```
